summary: This is an email from Jeffrey Epstein dated June 29, 2010, responding to an inquiry about his whereabouts and travel plans to New York. The email includes a confidentiality footer claiming attorney-client privilege and designating the information as Epstein's property.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Sends an email responding to questions about his location and travel plans, indicating he is coming to New York on Sunday. The email footer asserts confidentiality and his ownership of the communication.

events.title: Epstein email about travel to New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein sends an email responding to an inquiry, stating he is coming to New York on Sunday.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was communicating via email on June 29, 2010, about his travel plans to New York.
The email includes a confidentiality footer claiming the communication may be attorney-client privileged and is the property of Jeffrey Epstein.
The footer instructs unintended recipients to notify a Gmail address (jrvaratinnOgmail con) and destroy the communication, indicating security concerns.
